content: my own the start of this square follows rachele carmona s plain granny square pattern and the sample was constructed using her seamless corner joining method you can find her youtube tutorial here … vibrant vintage 2018 plain granny square pattern r1 3dc ch1 x 4 into magic_ring 3sts per side ch1sp corners r2 3dc ch1 3dc inx ch1sp x 4 6sts per side ch1sp corners 3dc ch1 3dc inx ch1sp r3 3dc in each space between 3dc groups until next corner x 4 9sts per side ch1sp corners r4 as r3 12sts per side ch1sp corners 1hdc ch2 1hdc inx ch1sp r5 1hdc ieon 12sts x 4 first st may be hidden close with an invisible join 14sts per side ch2sp corners 1sc ch2 1sc inx ch2sp r6 sk1st 1tlsc ieon 13sts x 4 15sts per side ch2sp corners 1dc ch2 1dc inx ch2sp 2dc 5v or 12sts 5ch1sps per r7 sk1st v inx st sk1st repeat to next corner x 4 side ch2sp corners v ch2 v inx ch2sp 3pc 4v 6ch1sps or 11sts r8 ch1 popcorn inx v ch1 10ch1sps per side ch2sp v inx v ch1 popcorn inx v ch1 repeat to next corner x 4 corners v ch2 v inx ch2sp v inx v r9 v inx popcorn v inx v x 3 repeat to next corner work through the top and out the back of the popcorn rather than through the 9v or 18sts 9ch1sps per side actual stitch for a neater look ch2sp corners 1dc ch2 1dc inx ch2sp r10 3dc in each v across to next corner x 4 29sts per side ch2sp corners 1hdc ch2 1hdc inx ch2sp r11 1hdc in each st across to next corner x 4 close with an invisible join 31sts per side ch2sp corners 2dc ch2 2dc inx ch2sp r12 sk1st 1tldc ieon 30sts x 4 34 sts per side ch2sp corners 1sc ch2 1sc inx ch2sp r13 1sc ieon 34sts x 4 36 sts per side ch2sp corners and you re done although the square should lie fairly flat and straight hot off the hook it would benefit from being blocked to ease out the v-stitches and show off the laciness to best effect i hope you enjoy making this pattern if you come across any errors or are having trouble you can contact me by email at bronzeknot@yahoo com 2019 © lynn johnson -
